utterances.speaker: KATHERINE TIMPF, HOST
utterances.utterance: Yes, that will happen sometime. Yes. Sorry. I just swallowed my gum, and it's kind of stuck in my throat. So, next time, I won't have gum. Yes, look, I wasn't a fan of the tweets myself. I've said so, I'll say so again. But you know, who I think is actually a big fan. The biggest fan is the media that pretends that they hate the tweets.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: They saw that he tweeted this and they weren't thinking, "Oh, no, the President is ..." they were like, "Yes, no work tomorrow. Just going to call the President racist all day." They don't actually have to do -- I mean, that would be -- if that was my job, just to repeat the same word over and over again. That'd be great. I would have to read a lot less. I could chill. I could take more naps. It would be wonderful. I think that all of their outrage, they have fun doing it. And so I think it's a little bit disingenuous. It's not like they are going against the grain by saying something like this. They're making some bold statement. They are saying what they know everybody wants them to say and they're having a good time doing it. So, I don't like the tweets myself. But I also think it's strange to see how gleeful people get over it and pretending they don't like it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. It's awesome content for slow summer months in the news, Tyrus. Round this out?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: You are all racist.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Every one of you. Racist, racist, racist. You know, I'm going to be racist, too. So, now that we're all racist, can we get back to the actual conversation?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Because I don't know what the hell the four of them are complaining about anymore. And I'm confused, when I was growing up, I knew who the racist old man was on the corner of my street because he said very specific things to me when I stepped on his yard. And it usually centered around the pigmentation of my skin.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Some epitaph.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: You know what I'm saying? Now, if you tell someone "leave," it's racist. Because I remember there was -- and I was talking to Mr. Baker about it. It used to be an American slogan if you don't like it, you can leave.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: It was like America love it or leave. It was pretty much a normal thing, and a 70-year-old man from that era might say, if you don't like the way I do things you can leave, racist. Where?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He said the same thing is essentially to the U.K. Prime Minister. He said to the U.K. Minister, you've got to go.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: And you don't have to actually be a racist to be racist anymore. You just have to say, watch this, racist, somebody in here is like, "Hmmm, maybe." That's just where we are now.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right, coming up. CNN holds a lottery and Biden wants to do pushups. The result. Both look really stupid.

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.utterance: And now, “The Greg Gutfeld Show” presents "The 2020 CAN'T- idates."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: As his campaign dies, he wants to exercise. So, if Joe Biden becomes the nominee, how would he handle Trump on the debate stage? What would he say?

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN, D-PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.utterance: Come on, Donald. Come on, man. How many pushups you want to do here, pal? Jokingly. You know, come on, run with me, man.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Come on, man. Run with me, man. I can't tell if he's running for President or auditioning for a Cheech and Chong movie.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There's a reference. Anyway, the next debate will be on CNN. And because there's so many candidates, CNN spent an entire hour deciding which candidates would debate when, by picking names out of a box. So, to be fair and transparent to everybody. Here you go.

utterances.speaker: WOLF BLITZER, CNN HOST
utterances.utterance: A lot of thought and care has gone into this process to make sure it's transparent and fair.

utterances.speaker: BRIANNA KEILAR, CNN HOST
utterances.utterance: We believe that this process should be as transparent as possible. Because we are being very open about this process, we have multiple camera views including an overhead camera. We want you to see everything that we are doing.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: A reminder, for full transparency, you can watch the camera but me overhead.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Remember, we have these overhead cameras for complete confidence, full transparency, you can see everything I'm doing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's a lot like my bedroom. This had everything -- boxes, names, date, crazy camera angles, and of course because it's CNN, a panel of 300 people to explain the importance of picking names out of a box. Why don't you try to hone down your panel instead of the debates? It even had a sponsor.

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.utterance: "The Draw" brought to you by "Once Upon a Time in Hollywood," starring Leonardo DiCaprio and Brad Pitt.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The anticipation is killing me. This must be the most amazing lottery ever.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: John Hickenlooper, he will take the stage on Tuesday, July 30th.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Cory Booker. He will hit the stage in Detroit on Wednesday, July 31st.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Kamala Harris, she will be debating on Wednesday, July 31.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: My god. Riveting. They dragged that out for an hour. It's like bingo without winning anything.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right, Stephen -- Stephen, I said, yesterday, I believe that CNN's like a person who has no close friends. They don't tell them when they look stupid.

utterances.speaker: MILLER
utterances.utterance: Yes, I would say that's just about right for -- and this is the thing like what Kat said about all the hooting and hollering over the atmosphere over Trump's rallies, the circus atmosphere.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MILLER
utterances.utterance: Here, you have CNN turning the Democratic debate into the Hunger Games like literally. Like I was ready to see like, you know, Cory Booker bust through the doors, "I volunteer as tribute. I volunteer as tribute." Just to get on the stage with Biden and break one percent. Yes, also that clip with Biden. I mean, when he gets the nomination, let's just get rid of the moderators. Let's just rent a home depot parking lot. Clear the cars out, get rid of the moderators, put Biden there and put Trump and put a festivus pole right in the middle. And just let them get over it because I don't think Biden win that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: MILLER
utterances.utterance: It is never too late to give up, Joe.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Tyrus, what do you make of this?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Well, thanks to my co-captain on my podcast, Timpf, over here. I like gangster Biden. "You want to do pushups." So his new name is what?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Grandpa.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: You know, a lot of -- CNN, I think somewhere if you look at their production roster, somebody got fired from the WWE because we tried that a couple of times, and it didn't work then. "Who will wrestle tonight? We'll pull from a hat," and while you're pulling from the hat, people are changing the channel.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: That description alone that -- we have six -- click. No one wants to hear that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, I know why -- you know why they did that though, Kat, is because of the Bernie fiasco. They were trying to say this isn't rigged like what we did to Bernie for Hillary back in 2016.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Yes, but they're still going to say it's rigged, Bernie supporters.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Because they get all of their opinions from weed. You think Bernie supporters are sitting around watching CNN? No, they're sitting around watching weed that they're smoking. But I'm personally glad that Joe Biden made the pushup comment because finally we're talking about it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: You know, like I'm a single issue voter and that issue for me is pushup.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I mean, I go in the ballot box. Who do I think could do more pushups? And then, I, you know, Google photos of them first. I try to zoom in on the arms and I really -- so I'm really glad he brought this up because if it's true that he can do more pushups than -- I am a single issue. Now, what matters more in this country than your our muscles, any President?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And if you adopt this as a barometer, guys serving life at a super max prison should be President because those guys --

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Well, hold on, let's be real, the score is going to be six to four. Let's be real. Let's be real. Ain't like Biden going to be pushing and clapping, you know, Trump with one hand. Both guys are going to be after one and two go and this is a really bad idea. Go to commercial, let's just talk about it. Or Mr. Trump, clearly that's a stunt double. Like, you know what I am saying, like --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Last word, Mike? You could do a hundred pushups.

utterances.speaker: BAKER
utterances.utterance: Yes, I think right now, Tyrus and I should just right here. Let's do it. Right now.

utterances.speaker: MILLER
utterances.utterance: Let's do that.

utterances.speaker: BAKER
utterances.utterance: Let's do that.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Let's do that.

utterances.speaker: BAKER
utterances.utterance: But look, Biden is what? 76 years old.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BAKER
utterances.utterance: Trump is -- President Trump is 72. Nobody wants to see this. Nobody wants to be subjected.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Shirtless.

utterances.speaker: MILLER
utterances.utterance: I want to see it.

utterances.speaker: BAKER
utterances.utterance: Two shirtless dudes doing calisthenics.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Yes, I want to see it.

utterances.speaker: MILLER
utterances.utterance: I want to see that.

utterances.speaker: BAKER
utterances.utterance: I am wrong. Everybody, apparently wants to see this. But look, this is -- it's absurd. I would have preferred when they did this on CNN that they did one of those lottery drawing with a big barrel of ping pong balls. Right? And they have -- I can't say that, never mind. Okay, so I'm done. Ever since political correctness, I have just been -- I have been --

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Did you read your notes? Read your notes.

utterances.speaker: BAKER
utterances.utterance: I can't say anything anymore.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Here you can.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I know.

utterances.speaker: BAKER
utterances.utterance: Because of where we are in society today.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, you know what --

utterances.speaker: BAKER
utterances.utterance: I'm sorry. So, I'm going to shut up right now.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You always say that, but you never do.

utterances.speaker: BAKER
utterances.utterance: That's true.

utterances.speaker: BAKER
utterances.utterance: So, I guess my point is --

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Did you bring your notes? He always has notes when he gets --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: To the roll of the music. Coming up, we discuss the only interesting Democrat running for President. That's next. Yes.

utterances.speaker: AISHAH HASNIE, CORRESPONDENT
utterances.utterance: Live from "America's News Headquarters," I'm Aishah Hasnie. A massive heat wave gripping much of the nation is being blamed for at least six deaths. Four people died in Maryland, one in Arizona and another in Arkansas. High heat and humidity is making it feel like it's over 100 degrees in many cities. Baltimore logged the heat index of 122. New York has declared an emergency canceling or postponing events. And the Braintree Police Department in Massachusetts telling residents to put crime on hold at least until Monday saying it is quote "hot as soccer balls out there." Overseas, 12 people died after a gas plant exploded in Central China. The force of the blast shattered windows and blew out doors within a two-mile radius. More than a dozen others were injured. No word yet on what caused that blast. I'm Aishah Hasnie, now back to “The Greg Gutfeld Show.” For all your headlines, log on to foxnews.com.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Like a soothing dove, she brings a message of love. You know Marianne Williamson, the one who said she is harnessing love to beat Trump in 2020?

utterances.speaker: MARIANNE WILLIAMSON, D-PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.utterance: I'm going to harness love for political purposes. I will meet you on that field and sir, love will win.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know it, you know. This week a POLITICO piece had some ideas for the Dems to improve the debates, including keeping fringe candidates like Marianne off the stage. But here's what's interesting, a new St. Anselm poll, my favorite, shows Marianne Williamson is ahead of Cory Booker and Kirsten Gillibrand in New Hampshire.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So, maybe that harnessing love crap works, and maybe it's working better than identity politics, which the left is so obsessed with. Here's what she told Dave Rubin about that.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMSON
utterances.utterance: You know, I always say, I talk about the same thing, whether I'm talking to rich people, poor people, English speaking people, Spanish speaking people, gay people, straight people, Jewish people, Christian people, Muslim people, I am talking to the American in all of them. That's what matters now. We need to have an American conversation.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, my God. She is making sense. She is harnessing me with love. Let's turn to our political correspondent, Chet Nancefurd for analysis. Chet, what do you think?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Chet's been harnessed by love, too. See it is spreading. Kat.

utterances.speaker: MILLER
utterances.utterance: That's right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Is she really the only interesting voice on that side or am I just falling in love and I don't know it?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Yes, I know, she is. She had a tweet this week that said the problem in our country is that we have not emotionally connected with the Declaration of Independence. And I've spent all day thinking about what that could possibly mean. I mean, does she want us to like rub crystals on it or like -- because I don't think like the National Archives lets you do that. Like, they keep that line moving quickly. They don't let you like go up to it and start talking about your childhood or whatever, however you emotionally bond, but I think she is wonderful. Still, the jury is out on how many pushups she can do. That will be the decision for me. But she's so captivating. What she said, did it make sense? And I've spent all day trying to figure out how to make sense of it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Reminds me of Trump, man. She is the odd person out, Tyrus, in this bunch.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Well, no, she is -- correction -- she is the only person in this bunch. And I mean that -- I mean, everyone is a human being. But I actually feel like what she is saying is genuine and real, albeit weird, but I know her name. Marianne Williamson. If you asked me to list the other ones who are not CNN correspondents who annoy me, because of silly stuff they say, this one -- she speaks and I'm like, "Oh, you know, cool. What is she talking about this week?"

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: And it's amazing to me that the Democratic Party, which is all about inclusion, and everyone is welcome are now saying, "She has got to go."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, exactly.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: She's got to go.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know what? They -- again, I go back to how -- I mean, I made fun of Trump for like six months. And I was completely like, "Who is laughing now?" I feel like she is -- I feel like she is going to rise up the ranks.

utterances.speaker: BAKER
utterances.utterance: Yes, well, not only is she above Gillibrand and Booker, she has got to be above de Blasio.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Of course, yes.

utterances.speaker: BAKER
utterances.utterance: Everybody is above de Blasio. But no, but Tyrus is absolutely right. Look, the party of inclusivity, but what are they doing? They're doing their standard -- if we don't like what you're saying, not only should you shut up, but we're going to figure out how to game the system to keep you off the stage.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: BAKER
utterances.utterance: Right? And the only thing that's going to get me through these debates exactly is her and now he has dropped out, people like Swalwell, every day, I was excited to see what crap he was going to kick out there. So yes, I say keep them in.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I know. All right, Stephen, you've been on the MW train since day one. So, let it let it rip.

utterances.speaker: MILLER
utterances.utterance: I love her.

utterances.speaker: MILLER
utterances.utterance: I love her so much. Yes, I mean, you have the DNC writing her off. You have CNN. You have the media running her off and everyone is making fun of her and everyone forgets that's exactly how we got the last President.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: MILLER
utterances.utterance: She said the most true thing in the last debate, you have Elizabeth Warren out there in the media and Warren has got a plan. I've got a plan to fix. I've got a plan for everything. And Marianne Williamson walks out and goes, "You know, how Trump won? Trump -- he didn't say I had a plan. He walked out and said, 'Let's make America great again." And Trump won. Elizabeth Warren pretended to be a Native American for 25 years. Marianne Williamson entered the spirit world in one debate.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: She is the only one who I believe could hold a seance and bring back Benjamin Franklin.

utterances.speaker: BAKER
utterances.utterance: That's who you would want to bring back? Benjamin Franklin?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Yes, he seems like my favorite. Any questions about that? I think he could do the most pushups.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: She reminds me of the world's greatest babysitter, like she's like a soothing waterfall of warm milk.

utterances.speaker: MILLER
utterances.utterance: She'll be commander in brunch.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MILLER
utterances.utterance: The next -- the next debate -- in the next debate, she needs a glass of rose and a cigarette and she will win the debate.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Our President Trump will say anything. It's going to be a little hard to argue when she goes there. You know what I am saying like, that debate is going to be --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's going to be something else.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: I want to see Biden, no, I want to see that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I want to see that. You know what is going to happen, it's going to be like a Hallmark movie. They're going to fall in love -- marry -- he is going to resign and he will be President and she is going to be -- he is going to be her VP. It's going to be the greatest time of our lives.

utterances.speaker: MILLER
utterances.utterance: Better get real when CNN starts covering her rallies.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Scarlett Johansson is not in the picture.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: She gets attacked because she wants to act, actress Scarlett Johansson -- never heard of her -- got in trouble after saying this in an interview quote, "You know as an actor, I should be able to play any person or any tree or any animal because that's my job and the requirements of my job." She would be great as a tree. But the outrage mob on Twitter called her statement proof of white privilege. Later, Scar Joe said she was taken out of context and that she supports diversity in film. Last year, she was cast in a film where she would play a trans-man. The social media pressure was so intense, she dropped out. If only there were a place where actors could learn what roles were acceptable in 2019.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Hi, I'm saw your Sawyer St. Sebastian and I run WAA. Woke Acting Academy. In my class, you'll learn the appropriate roles that you can play without appropriating the life experiences of others.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Wait, but isn't the whole point of acting to like, you know, play different characters?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Only if you want to be an entitled "Bigot Derek," now get out of my class. Get out. Now, what are we auditioning for this week? Yes?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: I'm up for a part in the next Avatar film.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Of course, you are white male. I bet you never even considered the fact that you're taking that role away from actual blue space aliens, did you? In my class, we only teach the woke acting method. Now, who else?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I actually got a call back to play a serial killer.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Have you ever killed anyone?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: What? No?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Then give it up or kill one of your classmates.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: What?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: I said kill one of your classmates. Now, what will you learn at WAA? Other than how privileged you are? Not much really. You certainly won't learn anything about acting. But at least you won't upset the basement dwelling activists on Twitter.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Oh.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Yes?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I killed Toby.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Oh, great. Go out there and murder that part. You see at WAA, you might never become a star. But at least you learn how to murder people.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Is someone going to call an ambulance?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right, Tyrus, I think you're the only actor here.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: We're all acting, bro. Racist.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Does she have a point? I mean, what point? I don't know.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Scarlett's original statement was authentic and true. And what it is to be an actor. So she was 100 percent right. The disappointing part was that she folded.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Because she didn't say anything wrong. You're an actor. It's make believe, you're playing a part. And as much as it breaks my heart like take "The Lion King" that came up for example, you could audition as many lines as you want to play that role. Chances are at some point, they're going to eat somebody. You just can't trust the damn lion on set.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, you can't.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: So that's the world we live in. Acting is about playing a different part. It doesn't -- you don't have to be -- the thing is you play. Darth Vader really wasn't an amputee guy who could move things with his head. He wasn't that -- that wasn't who he was. He was a made up character.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Was that what he was?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: It's made up. Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I had no idea.

utterances.speaker: MILLER
utterances.utterance: I didn't take that from the movie.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I know. No, no. But shouldn't -- Stephen, isn't she stealing roles from the people that she is trying to play?

utterances.speaker: MILLER
utterances.utterance: No. I mean, this is the thing. Felicity Huffman in 2005 was nominated for an Oscar for "Transamerica." Jared Leto in 2017, won an Oscar for "Dallas Buyers Club." And so what actually -- and what actually happened here was you didn't get a film about representation. What happened is Scarlett Johansson left the project, which she was also producing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: MILLER
utterances.utterance: And you killed the film about a renowned trans-man that you know, was a -- you know the film probably would have looked on positively and would have gotten positive attention. And now you don't have a film. And so what you have is a case of just the snake eating its tail. And I mean, guys, good luck. Have fun with that. So yes, I don't know. Scarlett Johansson can play whatever she wants. She can play a tree and I would pay to go see that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But that would take a job from a tree, Mike.

utterances.speaker: BAKER
utterances.utterance: Yes. That's true. Okay, so I'm in this West Hollywood hotel, and --

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Oh boy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I like it --

utterances.speaker: BAKER
utterances.utterance: It's great, right?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Kids, ear muffs.

utterances.speaker: BAKER
utterances.utterance: Okay, so I got so I got my --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Did you have a tie around your neck? Anyway, go ahead.

utterances.speaker: BAKER
